com.datamirror.ts.target.publication.userexit.kafka

Interface KafkaKcopOperationInIF


  • public interface KafkaKcopOperationInIF
    This interface is intended to provide operation specific information to a KCOP. The operation specific information includes:
    Avro records describing the column data resulting from the change on the source table;
    The type of operation;
    The intended topic name and partition.

    All of these values can be considered and adjusted in the process of KCOP processing and the ultimate production of a Kafka producer record.

    Eg. the intended topic name may not be the topic name the KCOP ultimately uses for the resultant producer record as per the KcopTopicMappingIntegrated KCOP.

    • Method Detail

      • getReplicationEventType

        int getReplicationEventType()
        Returns:
        The Type of event that data is being provided for. An event type as defined in the class ReplicationEventTypes. eg. public static final int BEFORE_INSERT_EVENT = 0x10; Only events subscribed to via the ReplicationEventPublisherIF object's subscribeEvent method are ones that will be potentially returned by this method during runtime.

      • getKafkaAvroKeyGenericRecord

        org.apache.avro.generic.GenericRecord getKafkaAvroKeyGenericRecord()
        Returns:
        An Object implementing GenericRecord describing the Kafka Key for this operation. This generic record is typically serialized to produce the bytes for the key. In the case that no Kafka key is defined this value will return null. In the case of an update this key represents the key of the row as a result of the update.

      • getKafkaAvroValueGenericRecord

        org.apache.avro.generic.GenericRecord getKafkaAvroValueGenericRecord()
        Returns:
        An Object implementing GenericRecord describing the Kafka Value for this operation. This generic record is typically serialized to produce the bytes for the value. The kafkaAvroValueGenericRecord can be a null value in the case of a delete. When not null, the kafkaAvroValueGenericRecord includes values for key columns and so those values will appear in both the kafkaAvroKeyGenericReocrd and the kafkaAvroValueGenericRecord. For an update operation this value represents the value of the row as a result of the update on the source.

      • getKafkaAvroUpdatedKeyGenericRecord

        org.apache.avro.generic.GenericRecord getKafkaAvroUpdatedKeyGenericRecord()
        Returns:
        An Object implementing GenericRecord describing the Kafka Key prior to the changes an update operation will cause. If an Update operation does not change the key, or the operation is not an update operation, this will be null. This value can be made use of by a KCOP processing an update to issue a delete for an old key before generating a Kafka Record to provide the new value at the new key.

      • getKafkaAvroBeforeValueGenericRecord

        org.apache.avro.generic.GenericRecord getKafkaAvroBeforeValueGenericRecord()
        Returns:
        An Object implementing GenericRecord describing the Kafka Value prior to changes a delete or update operation will cause. This will be null in the case of an insert. This value can be made use of for audit like contextual understanding where the KCOP is processing a delete or update operation and needs to have the value of the row prior to this delete or update being applied.

      • getPartition

        java.lang.Integer getPartition()
        Returns:
        The partition that the default behavior of the CDC Kafka Target Engine would normally choose. A null value indicates that a partitioner class is defined for the Kafka Producer in the kafkaproducer.properties file.

      • getKafkaTopicName

        java.lang.String getKafkaTopicName()
        Returns:
        The kafkaTopicName to which the Kafka record would be written by default behavior. If a prefix is not defined this format is <CDC Target Instance>.<Subscription Name>.<Source Database>.<Source Schema>.<Table Name>

      • getUserExitJournalHeader

        com.datamirror.ts.target.publication.userexit.JournalHeaderIF getUserExitJournalHeader()
        Returns:
        The UserExitJournal Header contains the get functions for retrieving the JCF values of the operation represented by this KafkaKcopOperationIn object.

      • getUserExitBeforeJournalHeader

        com.datamirror.ts.target.publication.userexit.JournalHeaderIF getUserExitBeforeJournalHeader()
        Returns:
        The UserExitJournal Header contains the get functions for retrieving the JCF values prior to this operation.
